intro: Conospermum marginatum, commonly known as the Narrow-leaved Grevillea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and striking yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments. It is often found in heathlands and coastal dunes, where it thrives in full sun. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in suitable climates.
